comments.body: Agreed it kinda just feels like you would only seek it out for soul soil and easy basalt.It would greatly benefit from some vegetation.

vegetation is definitely a must in the soulsand valley. plus I am a bit disappointed with the fossils generated in it. Too small and don't look must like skeletons. I thing including maybe including dangerous vegetation along with more fossils remains could be a serious plus to the biome

I feel like vegetation defeats the purpose of the soul sand valley. It is supposed to be an empty valley full of fossils and dried lava (basalt), not so much a place that would have any vegetation.

It sort of make sense to have plant in the soul sand valley, but in real life there's plant down there so ok.

I think unique structures/mobs is the way to go for this. The soul sand valley is supposed to feel devoid of life but there needs to be a reason to go exploring in it outside of soul soil and the most efficient way to get soil sand/soil for soul campfires, torches and lanterns

The mildly infuriating part is how, if you hack a nether portal block in the game using /setblock, you get a completely normal nether, limited to the old world type size.

If they re add the nether reactor for old type worlds then they could update the items so that 1-3 blazerods spawn in the loot, along with 4 soulsand and 1 nether wart, also they could have the chanve to drop a wither skeleton skull but it would have the same drop rate as killing a wither skeleton without looting, also they could have biome varients of it with plains biomes being the normal one, desert/savannah biomes spawning 3 blazes instead of 3 zombie pigmen (because the desert/savannah is hot), swamp biomes spawning 3 magma cubes instead of zombiepigmen (because the nether reactor corrupts slimes turning them into magma cubes), and snowy biomes spawning wither skeletons instead of strays (because the nether reactor corrupts strays turning them into wither skeletons), also it would give us a way to get obsidian in old type worlds meaning that players would be able to enchant without fishing and get quartz and get glowstone so we can make Redstone launterns. In infinite worlds if the nether reactor is gotten by converting a world to infinite placing it on the ground without the cobble stone or blocks of gold would spawn a 5x5 nether portal and if you try to activate it using the structure with the 14 cobblestone and 4 blocks of gold it says in chat "unable to complete ritual"

This would be incredible! End Sand sounds beautiful and so do the pools.

If you didn’t understand: The End needs way more additions to make it more fun, so I thought of some. First of all, the End city part of the End needs more colors. There should be End Sand that can be purple or magenta. This would make the End more vibrant. Caves need to be added, with shulkers and endermites spawning in them, protecting loot. There should be more chorus plants on the ground. Some of them should give players effects, for example, levitate a player or teleport a player randomly. These plants should be pinkish blue and, for some, purple. There should also be a liquid that spawns in holes in the ground. It should give off a bright blue glow and if a player gets into it, it should give them a jump boost or such. Overall this would make the End more beautiful or vibrant. Hope you like the idea.
end sand + ender acid = a beach... end beach(endermen in shorts XD)
maybe mixin end water and lave will make acid wich when lighted explodes
mixin end water and water should make end obsidion wich makes a portal to the end and back. good if you are lost

So, this sounds like a great idea, but what about the fact that the end is supposed to be space? Maybe one of the plants grows a fruit that gives a player levitation, like the chorus plant, and when they grow near each other, they "sing" together. Like, say... a harmony fruit plant growing near a chorus fruit plant causes them to sing giving the end an otherworldly feel, while still making it more vibrant.

Maybe, the end sand can be used for end glass, which in turn, is used to make bigger, grander end cities, hinting towards the once-grand civilization that is hinted to have once populated the world. Give the end a bit more substance to it, ya know? It feels like they did the bare minimum for it to qualify as it's own dimension sometimes. I do know they did their best though, and it shows. Back to the topic at hand, maybe an endstone variant or end sandstone to give more life to the cities, and maybe end fortresses to show the period where they fought the end dragon and possibly endermen.

i really like the idea of pocket dimensions. Maybe some sort of passive astetic mobs could spawn in there? I imagine some sort of purple magma cube on two legs, or the same but floating, and a bit like the glare.  And then you need to put like a specific order of items in the shulker end chest to like make sure you get to that precise dimension, and get your items back. But there should be some sort of way to not make it as OP cuz like infinite room every where is just not that balanced some of my ideas would be to like have some sort of mobs that steal your items, or what i like better is that it costs something to get in the dimension, lapiz lazuli would be the perfect fit. Maybe some other magic-like items like redstone, amethyst, sculk shards, blaze rods and more. More expensive ones like sculk shards and blaze rods should give you more room, and maybe some special blocks, that only spawn when you do that. Great idea!

Previous commenters don't seem to get the idea at all. The pocket dimension as outlined here makes the player's storage system portable, making this a huge upgrade to the value of investing a lot of effort into the storage system, like building an item sorter, and also adds value to having multiple bases in different biomes. Currently, the maximum amount of stuff a player can bring with them to a new location is one player inventory + one chest boat + one Ender Chest, all full of Shulker boxes. With the pocket dimension, that amount becomes infinite. Late game players would be incentivized to create a lot of empty space in the pocket dimension, to build more and more of their base there. This would enable a fully nomadic play style without sacrificing the amenities of a base. It would be a lot easier to keep old worlds alive and move from place to place as biomes get updated.

An end dimension update would be cool, but likely to retain its barren and bleak atmosphere. It should be subtle tweaks to biomes, like various island generation designs, minimal creepy plants, maybe ruins structures with end bricks. Some of the ideas in the main post are too OP or never going to happen.

This update would make it fun to explore the ocean. Maybe there could also be new tropical flowers for the tropic islands.

It would take fine balance between retaining its intended barren feel but still offer more variety. Break up the outer island generation to have different forms, like some more broken up and jagged, some full of holes/caves, some with few different flora and some devoid of them, some with ancient ruined structures with end bricks or broken down end cities and ships. Maybe even a mini-boss related to shulkers, hidden in a basement of end cities or something.
I agree, the end is the next logical space to spruce up. There are a lot of space-y biome types you can implement that are still devoid of life. Icey, red, glowing, metallic, crystals, etc

Just think that caves and cliffs updates the over world in 1.17 - 1.19 the the nether gets updated in 1.16, so why not make 1.20 the end update? Right now the end is  just like the nether before it’s update. Let’s keep voting and bring the change!
